compounddef.title: Compute the Structure with Maximum Expected Accuracy (MEA)

briefdescription.para: Compute a MEA (maximum expected accuracy) structure.

detaileddescription.para: The algorithm maximizes the expected accuracy

Higher values of $\gamma$ result in more base pairs of lower probability and thus higher sensitivity. Low values of $\gamma$ result in structures containing only highly likely pairs (high specificity). The code of the MEA function also demonstrates the use of sparse dynamic programming scheme to reduce the time and memory complexity of folding.

simplesect.para: vrna_pf() must be executed on input parameter fc

parameterdescription.para: The fold compound data structure with pre-filled base pair probability matrix
The weighting factor for base pairs vs. unpaired nucleotides
A pointer to a variable where the MEA value will be written to

simplesect.para: An MEA structure (or NULL on any error)

parblock.para: This function is attached as overloaded method MEA(gamma = 1.) to objects of type fold_compound. Note, that it returns the MEA structure and MEA value as a tuple (MEA_structure, MEA). See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.MEA()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

memberdef.argsstring: (vrna_ep_t *plist, const char *sequence, double gamma, vrna_md_t *md, float *mea)
memberdef.name: vrna_MEA_from_plist

briefdescription.para: Compute a MEA (maximum expected accuracy) structure from a list of probabilities.

detaileddescription.para: The algorithm maximizes the expected accuracy

Higher values of $\gamma$ result in more base pairs of lower probability and thus higher sensitivity. Low values of $\gamma$ result in structures containing only highly likely pairs (high specificity). The code of the MEA function also demonstrates the use of sparse dynamic programming scheme to reduce the time and memory complexity of folding.

simplesect.para: The unpaired probabilities $p^u_i = 1 - \sum_{j \neq i} p_{ij}$ are usually computed from the supplied pairing probabilities $p_{ij}$ as stored in plist entries of type VRNA_PLIST_TYPE_BASEPAIR. To overwrite individual $p^u_o$ values simply add entries with type VRNA_PLIST_TYPE_UNPAIRED To include G-Quadruplex support, the corresponding field in md must be set.

parameterdescription.para: A list of base pair probabilities the MEA structure is computed from
The RNA sequence that corresponds to the list of probability values
The weighting factor for base pairs vs. unpaired nucleotides
A model details data structure (maybe NULL)
A pointer to a variable where the MEA value will be written to

simplesect.para: An MEA structure (or NULL on any error)

parblock.para: This function is available as overloaded function MEA_from_plist(gamma = 1., md = NULL). Note, that it returns the MEA structure and MEA value as a tuple (MEA_structure, MEA). See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:func:`RNA.MEA_from_plist()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

briefdescription.para: Computes a MEA (maximum expected accuracy) structure.

detaileddescription.para: The algorithm maximizes the expected accuracy

Higher values of $\gamma$ result in more base pairs of lower probability and thus higher sensitivity. Low values of $\gamma$ result in structures containing only highly likely pairs (high specificity). The code of the MEA function also demonstrates the use of sparse dynamic programming scheme to reduce the time and memory complexity of folding.
